member.name: T:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.CreateSignalingChannelRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateSignalingChannel operation. Creates a signaling channel.
CreateSignalingChannel is an asynchronous operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.CreateSignalingChannelRequest.ChannelName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelName.
A name for the signaling channel that you are creating. It must be unique for each AWS account and AWS Region.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.CreateSignalingChannelRequest.ChannelType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelType.
A type of the signaling channel that you are creating. Currently, SINGLE_MASTER is the only supported channel type.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.CreateSignalingChannelRequest.SingleMasterConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SingleMasterConfiguration.
A structure containing the configuration for the SINGLE_MASTER channel type.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.CreateSignalingChannelRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A set of tags (key-value pairs) that you want to associate with this channel.

member.name: T:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.CreateSignalingChannelResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateSignalingChannel operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.CreateSignalingChannelResponse.ChannelARN
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelARN.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the created channel.

member.name: T:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.CreateStreamRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateStream operation. Creates a new Kinesis video stream.
When you create a new stream, Kinesis Video Streams assigns it a version number. When you change the stream's metadata, Kinesis Video Streams updates the version.
CreateStream is an asynchronous operation.
For information about how the service works, see How it Works.
You must have permissions for the KinesisVideo:CreateStream action.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.CreateStreamRequest.DataRetentionInHours
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataRetentionInHours.
The number of hours that you want to retain the data in the stream. Kinesis Video Streams retains the data in a data store that is associated with the stream.
The default value is 0, indicating that the stream does not persist data.
When the DataRetentionInHours value is 0, consumers can still consume the fragments that remain in the service host buffer, which has a retention time limit of 5 minutes and a retention memory limit of 200 MB. Fragments are removed from the buffer when either limit is reached.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.CreateStreamRequest.DeviceName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeviceName.
The name of the device that is writing to the stream.
In the current implementation, Kinesis Video Streams does not use this name.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.CreateStreamRequest.KmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyId.
The ID of the AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key that you want Kinesis Video Streams to use to encrypt stream data.
If no key ID is specified, the default, Kinesis Video-managed key (aws/kinesisvideo) is used.
For more information, see DescribeKey.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.CreateStreamRequest.MediaType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MediaType.
The media type of the stream. Consumers of the stream can use this information when processing the stream. For more information about media types, see Media Types. If you choose to specify the MediaType, see Naming Requirements for guidelines.
Example valid values include "video/h264" and "video/h264,audio/aac".
This parameter is optional; the default value is null (or empty in JSON).

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.CreateStreamRequest.StreamName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamName.
A name for the stream that you are creating.
The stream name is an identifier for the stream, and must be unique for each account and region.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.CreateStreamRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A list of tags to associate with the specified stream. Each tag is a key-value pair (the value is optional).

member.name: T:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.CreateStreamResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateStream operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.CreateStreamResponse.StreamARN
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamARN.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the stream.

member.name: T:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.DeleteSignalingChannelRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteSignalingChannel operation. Deletes a specified signaling channel. DeleteSignalingChannel is an asynchronous operation. If you don't specify the channel's current version, the most recent version is deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.DeleteSignalingChannelRequest.ChannelARN
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelARN.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the signaling channel that you want to delete.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.DeleteSignalingChannelRequest.CurrentVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CurrentVersion.
The current version of the signaling channel that you want to delete. You can obtain the current version by invoking the DescribeSignalingChannel or ListSignalingChannels API operations.

member.name: T:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.DeleteSignalingChannelResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteSignalingChannel operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.DeleteStreamRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteStream operation. Deletes a Kinesis video stream and the data contained in the stream.
This method marks the stream for deletion, and makes the data in the stream inaccessible immediately.
To ensure that you have the latest version of the stream before deleting it, you can specify the stream version. Kinesis Video Streams assigns a version to each stream. When you update a stream, Kinesis Video Streams assigns a new version number. To get the latest stream version, use the DescribeStream API.
This operation requires permission for the KinesisVideo:DeleteStream action.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.DeleteStreamRequest.CurrentVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CurrentVersion.
Optional: The version of the stream that you want to delete.
Specify the version as a safeguard to ensure that your are deleting the correct stream. To get the stream version, use the DescribeStream API.
If not specified, only the CreationTime is checked before deleting the stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.DeleteStreamRequest.StreamARN
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamARN.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the stream that you want to delete.

member.name: T:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.DeleteStreamResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteStream operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.GetDataEndpointRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetDataEndpoint operation. Gets an endpoint for a specified stream for either reading or writing. Use this endpoint in your application to read from the specified stream (using the GetMedia or GetMediaForFragmentList operations) or write to it (using the PutMedia operation).
The returned endpoint does not have the API name appended. The client needs to add the API name to the returned endpoint.
In the request, specify the stream either by StreamName or StreamARN.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.GetDataEndpointRequest.APIName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property APIName.
The name of the API action for which to get an endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.GetDataEndpointRequest.StreamARN
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamARN.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the stream that you want to get the endpoint for. You must specify either this parameter or a StreamName in the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.GetDataEndpointRequest.StreamName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamName.
The name of the stream that you want to get the endpoint for. You must specify either this parameter or a StreamARN in the request.

member.name: T:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.GetDataEndpointResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetDataEndpoint operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.GetDataEndpointResponse.DataEndpoint
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataEndpoint.
The endpoint value. To read data from the stream or to write data to it, specify this endpoint in your application.

member.name: T:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.GetSignalingChannelEndpointRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetSignalingChannelEndpoint operation. Provides an endpoint for the specified signaling channel to send and receive messages. This API uses the SingleMasterChannelEndpointConfiguration input parameter, which consists of the Protocols and Role properties.
Protocols is used to determine the communication mechanism. For example, if you specify WSS as the protocol, this API produces a secure websocket endpoint. If you specify HTTPS as the protocol, this API generates an HTTPS endpoint.
Role determines the messaging permissions. A MASTER role results in this API generating an endpoint that a client can use to communicate with any of the viewers on the channel. A VIEWER role results in this API generating an endpoint that a client can use to communicate only with a MASTER.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.GetSignalingChannelEndpointRequest.ChannelARN
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelARN.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the signalling channel for which you want to get an endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.GetSignalingChannelEndpointRequest.SingleMasterChannelEndpointConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SingleMasterChannelEndpointConfiguration.
A structure containing the endpoint configuration for the SINGLE_MASTER channel type.

member.name: T:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.GetSignalingChannelEndpointResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetSignalingChannelEndpoint operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.GetSignalingChannelEndpointResponse.ResourceEndpointList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceEndpointList.
A list of endpoints for the specified signaling channel.

member.name: T:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.ListSignalingChannelsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListSignalingChannels operation. Returns an array of ChannelInfo objects. Each object describes a signaling channel. To retrieve only those channels that satisfy a specific condition, you can specify a ChannelNameCondition.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.ListSignalingChannelsRequest.ChannelNameCondition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelNameCondition.
Optional: Returns only the channels that satisfy a specific condition.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.ListSignalingChannelsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of channels to return in the response. The default is 500.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.ListSignalingChannelsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
If you specify this parameter, when the result of a ListSignalingChannels operation is truncated, the call returns the NextToken in the response. To get another batch of channels, provide this token in your next request.

member.summary: This is the response object from the ListSignalingChannels operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.ListSignalingChannelsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
If the response is truncated, the call returns this element with a token. To get the next batch of streams, use this token in your next request.

member.name: T:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.ListStreamsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListStreams operation. Returns an array of StreamInfo objects. Each object describes a stream. To retrieve only streams that satisfy a specific condition, you can specify a StreamNameCondition.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.ListStreamsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of streams to return in the response. The default is 10,000.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.ListStreamsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
If you specify this parameter, when the result of a ListStreams operation is truncated, the call returns the NextToken in the response. To get another batch of streams, provide this token in your next request.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.ListStreamsRequest.StreamNameCondition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamNameCondition.
Optional: Returns only streams that satisfy a specific condition. Currently, you can specify only the prefix of a stream name as a condition.

member.name: T:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.ListStreamsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListStreams operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.ListStreamsResponse.NextToken

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.SingleMasterChannelEndpointConfiguration.Protocols
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Protocols.
This property is used to determine the nature of communication over this SINGLE_MASTER signaling channel. If WSS is specified, this API returns a websocket endpoint. If HTTPS is specified, this API returns an HTTPS endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.SingleMasterChannelEndpointConfiguration.Role
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Role.
This property is used to determine messaging permissions in this SINGLE_MASTER signaling channel. If MASTER is specified, this API returns an endpoint that a client can use to receive offers from and send answers to any of the viewers on this signaling channel. If VIEWER is specified, this API returns an endpoint that a client can use only to send offers to another MASTER client on this signaling channel.

Container for the parameters to the TagStream operation. Adds one or more tags to a stream. A tag is a key-value pair (the value is optional) that you can define and assign to AWS resources. For more information, see Using Cost Allocation Tags in the AWS Billing and Cost Management User Guide.
You must provide either the StreamName or the StreamARN.
This operation requires permission for the KinesisVideo:TagStream action.
Kinesis video streams support up to 50 tags.

member.name: T:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.UpdateDataRetentionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateDataRetention operation. Increases or decreases the stream's data retention period by the value that you specify. To indicate whether you want to increase or decrease the data retention period, specify the Operation parameter in the request body. In the request, you must specify either the StreamName or the StreamARN.
The retention period that you specify replaces the current value.
This operation requires permission for the KinesisVideo:UpdateDataRetention action.
Changing the data retention period affects the data in the stream as follows:
If the data retention period is increased, existing data is retained for the new retention period. For example, if the data retention period is increased from one hour to seven hours, all existing data is retained for seven hours.
If the data retention period is decreased, existing data is retained for the new retention period. For example, if the data retention period is decreased from seven hours to one hour, all existing data is retained for one hour, and any data older than one hour is deleted immediately.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.UpdateDataRetentionRequest.CurrentVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CurrentVersion.
The version of the stream whose retention period you want to change. To get the version, call either the DescribeStream or the ListStreams API.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.UpdateDataRetentionRequest.DataRetentionChangeInHours
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataRetentionChangeInHours.
The retention period, in hours. The value you specify replaces the current value. The maximum value for this parameter is 87600 (ten years).

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.UpdateDataRetentionRequest.Operation
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Operation.
Indicates whether you want to increase or decrease the retention period.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamARN.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the stream whose retention period you want to change.

member.summary:

The name of the stream whose retention period you want to change.

Container for the parameters to the UpdateSignalingChannel operation. Updates the existing signaling channel. This is an asynchronous operation and takes time to complete.
If the MessageTtlSeconds value is updated (either increased or reduced), it only applies to new messages sent via this channel after it's been updated. Existing messages are still expired as per the previous MessageTtlSeconds value.

member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateSignalingChannel operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.UpdateStreamRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateStream operation. Updates stream metadata, such as the device name and media type.
You must provide the stream name or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the stream.
To make sure that you have the latest version of the stream before updating it, you can specify the stream version. Kinesis Video Streams assigns a version to each stream. When you update a stream, Kinesis Video Streams assigns a new version number. To get the latest stream version, use the DescribeStream API.
UpdateStream is an asynchronous operation, and takes time to complete.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.UpdateStreamRequest.CurrentVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CurrentVersion.
The version of the stream whose metadata you want to update.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.UpdateStreamRequest.DeviceName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeviceName.
The name of the device that is writing to the stream.
In the current implementation, Kinesis Video Streams does not use this name.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.UpdateStreamRequest.MediaType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MediaType.
The stream's media type. Use MediaType to specify the type of content that the stream contains to the consumers of the stream. For more information about media types, see Media Types. If you choose to specify the MediaType, see Naming Requirements.
To play video on the console, you must specify the correct video type. For example, if the video in the stream is H.264, specify video/h264 as the MediaType.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.UpdateStreamRequest.StreamARN
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamARN.
The ARN of the stream whose metadata you want to update.

member.name: P:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.UpdateStreamRequest.StreamName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamName.
The name of the stream whose metadata you want to update.
The stream name is an identifier for the stream, and must be unique for each account and region.

member.name: T:Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.UpdateStreamResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateStream operation.

member.summary:

When you create a new stream, Kinesis Video Streams assigns it a version number. When you change the stream's metadata, Kinesis Video Streams updates the version.

You must have permissions for the KinesisVideo:CreateStream action.

member.name: M:Amazon.KinesisVideo.AmazonKinesisVideoClient.DeleteStream(Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.DeleteStreamRequest)
member.summary:
Deletes a Kinesis video stream and the data contained in the stream.
This method marks the stream for deletion, and makes the data in the stream inaccessible immediately.
To ensure that you have the latest version of the stream before deleting it, you can specify the stream version. Kinesis Video Streams assigns a version to each stream. When you update a stream, Kinesis Video Streams assigns a new version number. To get the latest stream version, use the DescribeStream API.
This operation requires permission for the KinesisVideo:DeleteStream action.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeleteStream service method.
member.returns: The response from the DeleteStream service method, as returned by KinesisVideo.
member.exception: Kinesis Video Streams has throttled the request because you have exceeded the limit of allowed client calls. Try making the call later.
The value for this input parameter is invalid.
The caller is not authorized to perform this operation.
The signaling channel is currently not available for this operation.
Amazon Kinesis Video Streams can't find the stream that you specified.
The stream version that you specified is not the latest version. To get the latest version, use the DescribeStream API.

member.name: M:Amazon.KinesisVideo.AmazonKinesisVideoClient.GetDataEndpoint(Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.GetDataEndpointRequest)
member.summary:
Gets an endpoint for a specified stream for either reading or writing. Use this endpoint in your application to read from the specified stream (using the GetMedia or GetMediaForFragmentList operations) or write to it (using the PutMedia operation).
The returned endpoint does not have the API name appended. The client needs to add the API name to the returned endpoint.
In the request, specify the stream either by StreamName or StreamARN.

member.name: M:Amazon.KinesisVideo.AmazonKinesisVideoClient.GetSignalingChannelEndpoint(Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.GetSignalingChannelEndpointRequest)
member.summary:
Provides an endpoint for the specified signaling channel to send and receive messages. This API uses the SingleMasterChannelEndpointConfiguration input parameter, which consists of the Protocols and Role properties.
Protocols is used to determine the communication mechanism. For example, if you specify WSS as the protocol, this API produces a secure websocket endpoint. If you specify HTTPS as the protocol, this API generates an HTTPS endpoint.
Role determines the messaging permissions. A MASTER role results in this API generating an endpoint that a client can use to communicate with any of the viewers on the channel. A VIEWER role results in this API generating an endpoint that a client can use to communicate only with a MASTER.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetSignalingChannelEndpoint service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetSignalingChannelEndpoint service method, as returned by KinesisVideo.

member.name: M:Amazon.KinesisVideo.AmazonKinesisVideoClient.GetSignalingChannelEndpointAsync(Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.GetSignalingChannelEndpointRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Provides an endpoint for the specified signaling channel to send and receive messages. This API uses the SingleMasterChannelEndpointConfiguration input parameter, which consists of the Protocols and Role properties.
Protocols is used to determine the communication mechanism. For example, if you specify WSS as the protocol, this API produces a secure websocket endpoint. If you specify HTTPS as the protocol, this API generates an HTTPS endpoint.
Role determines the messaging permissions. A MASTER role results in this API generating an endpoint that a client can use to communicate with any of the viewers on the channel. A VIEWER role results in this API generating an endpoint that a client can use to communicate only with a MASTER.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetSignalingChannelEndpoint service method.

member.name: M:Amazon.KinesisVideo.AmazonKinesisVideoClient.UpdateDataRetention(Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.UpdateDataRetentionRequest)
member.summary:
Increases or decreases the stream's data retention period by the value that you specify. To indicate whether you want to increase or decrease the data retention period, specify the Operation parameter in the request body. In the request, you must specify either the StreamName or the StreamARN.
The retention period that you specify replaces the current value.
This operation requires permission for the KinesisVideo:UpdateDataRetention action.
Changing the data retention period affects the data in the stream as follows:
If the data retention period is increased, existing data is retained for the new retention period. For example, if the data retention period is increased from one hour to seven hours, all existing data is retained for seven hours.
If the data retention period is decreased, existing data is retained for the new retention period. For example, if the data retention period is decreased from seven hours to one hour, all existing data is retained for one hour, and any data older than one hour is deleted immediately.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateDataRetention service method.
member.returns: The response from the UpdateDataRetention service method, as returned by KinesisVideo.
member.exception: Kinesis Video Streams has throttled the request because you have exceeded the limit of allowed client calls. Try making the call later.
The value for this input parameter is invalid.
The caller is not authorized to perform this operation.
The signaling channel is currently not available for this operation.
Amazon Kinesis Video Streams can't find the stream that you specified.
The stream version that you specified is not the latest version. To get the latest version, use the DescribeStream API.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for UpdateDataRetention Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.KinesisVideo.IAmazonKinesisVideo.DeleteStream(Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.DeleteStreamRequest)
member.summary:
Deletes a Kinesis video stream and the data contained in the stream.
This method marks the stream for deletion, and makes the data in the stream inaccessible immediately.
To ensure that you have the latest version of the stream before deleting it, you can specify the stream version. Kinesis Video Streams assigns a version to each stream. When you update a stream, Kinesis Video Streams assigns a new version number. To get the latest stream version, use the DescribeStream API.
This operation requires permission for the KinesisVideo:DeleteStream action.

member.name: M:Amazon.KinesisVideo.IAmazonKinesisVideo.GetSignalingChannelEndpoint(Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.GetSignalingChannelEndpointRequest)
member.summary:
Provides an endpoint for the specified signaling channel to send and receive messages. This API uses the SingleMasterChannelEndpointConfiguration input parameter, which consists of the Protocols and Role properties.
Protocols is used to determine the communication mechanism. For example, if you specify WSS as the protocol, this API produces a secure websocket endpoint. If you specify HTTPS as the protocol, this API generates an HTTPS endpoint.
Role determines the messaging permissions. A MASTER role results in this API generating an endpoint that a client can use to communicate with any of the viewers on the channel. A VIEWER role results in this API generating an endpoint that a client can use to communicate only with a MASTER.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetSignalingChannelEndpoint service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetSignalingChannelEndpoint service method, as returned by KinesisVideo.

member.name: M:Amazon.KinesisVideo.IAmazonKinesisVideo.UpdateDataRetention(Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.UpdateDataRetentionRequest)
member.summary:
Increases or decreases the stream's data retention period by the value that you specify. To indicate whether you want to increase or decrease the data retention period, specify the Operation parameter in the request body. In the request, you must specify either the StreamName or the StreamARN.
The retention period that you specify replaces the current value.
This operation requires permission for the KinesisVideo:UpdateDataRetention action.
Changing the data retention period affects the data in the stream as follows:
If the data retention period is increased, existing data is retained for the new retention period. For example, if the data retention period is increased from one hour to seven hours, all existing data is retained for seven hours.
If the data retention period is decreased, existing data is retained for the new retention period. For example, if the data retention period is decreased from seven hours to one hour, all existing data is retained for one hour, and any data older than one hour is deleted immediately.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateDataRetention service method.
member.returns: The response from the UpdateDataRetention service method, as returned by KinesisVideo.
member.exception: Kinesis Video Streams has throttled the request because you have exceeded the limit of allowed client calls. Try making the call later.
The value for this input parameter is invalid.
The caller is not authorized to perform this operation.
The signaling channel is currently not available for this operation.
Amazon Kinesis Video Streams can't find the stream that you specified.
The stream version that you specified is not the latest version. To get the latest version, use the DescribeStream API.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for UpdateDataRetention Operation

Changing the data retention period affects the data in the stream as follows:
If the data retention period is increased, existing data is retained for the new retention period. For example, if the data retention period is increased from one hour to seven hours, all existing data is retained for seven hours.
If the data retention period is decreased, existing data is retained for the new retention period. For example, if the data retention period is decreased from seven hours to one hour, all existing data is retained for one hour, and any data older than one hour is deleted immediately.

member.name: M:Amazon.KinesisVideo.IAmazonKinesisVideo.UpdateSignalingChannel(Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.UpdateSignalingChannelRequest)
member.summary:
Updates the existing signaling channel. This is an asynchronous operation and takes time to complete.
If the MessageTtlSeconds value is updated (either increased or reduced), it only applies to new messages sent via this channel after it's been updated. Existing messages are still expired as per the previous MessageTtlSeconds value.

member.name: M:Amazon.KinesisVideo.IAmazonKinesisVideo.UpdateStream(Amazon.KinesisVideo.Model.UpdateStreamRequest)
member.summary:
Updates stream metadata, such as the device name and media type.
You must provide the stream name or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the stream.
To make sure that you have the latest version of the stream before updating it, you can specify the stream version. Kinesis Video Streams assigns a version to each stream. When you update a stream, Kinesis Video Streams assigns a new version number. To get the latest stream version, use the DescribeStream API.
UpdateStream is an asynchronous operation, and takes time to complete.
